title: Caprese Stuffed Portobellos
description: Large portobello caps roasted until tender and filled with fresh mozzarella, ripe tomato, basil, and a balsamic glaze for a bright, savory Caprese finish. Quick to prepare and oven-baked for a hands-off, flavor-packed vegetarian main or hearty appetizer.

ingredients.display_name: large portobello mushroom caps, cleaned and stems removed
ingredients.notes: wipe caps with damp paper towel and remove gills with spoon if desired
use high-quality fresh mozzarella; slice into 8 even slices

ingredients.display_name: ripe tomatoes (roma or vine), sliced 1/4-inch thick
ingredients.notes: slice thinly and remove excess seeds if very juicy

ingredients.display_name: balsamic vinegar (for glaze) or balsamic reduction
ingredients.notes: use a thicker glaze or reduce regular balsamic by simmering to coat-back consistency

ingredients.display_name: fresh thyme leaves (or 1/2 tsp dried), optional

ingredients.notes: season to taste before and after roasting

ingredients.display_name: red pepper flakes (optional, for a touch of heat)
ingredients.notes: use sparingly to keep mild spice level

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F (204°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment or foil for easy cleanup.

Prepare the mushrooms by gently wiping caps clean, removing stems and scraping gills if desired; brush each cap inside and out with olive oil and rub minced garlic over the inside surface, then season lightly with salt and pepper.
Arrange the portobello caps gill-side up on the prepared baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven until they begin to soften and release juices, about 10 minutes.

Remove the baking sheet from the oven; layer sliced tomato, a slice or two of fresh mozzarella, and a few basil leaves into each portobello cap, then sprinkle with dried oregano and optional thyme and red pepper flakes. Return to oven and bake until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 7 minutes.
Finish by drizzling each stuffed mushroom with balsamic glaze, adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper if needed, and garnish with remaining fresh basil before serving warm.
